column1: My friend John lives in Colorado
column2: not far from Denver; and he writes me
column5: walked out to see some prairie dogs.The prairie dog is about the size of a full grown squirrel
column6: and of a like color. It makes a hole for itself in the ground. This hole is in the shape of a tunnel
column7: and as large round as a man's hat.Now
column8: this little dog is so gentle
column9: that he lets the owl and the rattlesnake come and live with him
column10: if they like. All three are often found dwelling together. For my part
column11: I should not much like such neighbors.The prairie dogs live on the roots of grass. Scattered all around the entrance to their homes
column12: you may see remnants of the dry roots which they have got for food. They are quick in their movements
